maml:description.maml:para: Sends a login request to a Zabbix server API service.
The Connect-ZabbixServer cmdlet retreives the Api authentication key for the session using the credentials provided.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the Internet resource to which the web request is sent. This parameter supports HTTP and HTTPS values.
Specifies a user account that has permission to send the request. The default is the current user.
Type a user name, such as "User01" or "Domain\User01", or enter a PSCredential object, such as one generated by the Get-Credential cmdlet.
{{Fill Certificate Description}}
Specifies the name of the Zabbix server to utilize in contrusting the connection URI. If not using the default Zabbix configuration, please specify the full URI using the -Uri paramter.
Specifies using HTTPS when the -Server parameter is specified.
Specifies a user account that has permission to send the request. The default is the current user.
Type a user name, such as "User01" or "Domain\User01", or enter a PSCredential object, such as one generated by the Get-Credential cmdlet.
{{Fill Certificate Description}}
Specifies the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the Internet resource to which the web request is sent. This parameter supports HTTP and HTTPS values.
Specifies the name of the Zabbix server to utilize in contrusting the connection URI. If not using the default Zabbix configuration, please specify the full URI using the -Uri paramter.
Specifies using HTTPS when the -Server parameter is specified.
Specifies a user account that has permission to send the request. The default is the current user.
Type a user name, such as "User01" or "Domain\User01", or enter a PSCredential object, such as one generated by the Get-Credential cmdlet.
{{Fill Certificate Description}}

maml:alert.maml:para: Author: Trent Willingham Check out my other scripts and projects @ https://github.com/twillin912

dev:remarks.maml:para: Connect to the Zabbix server 'myserver' with the username 'myuser'. The connection URI will be 'http://myserver/zabbix/api_jsonrpc.php'.

maml:description.maml:para: Sends a logout request to a Zabbix server API service.
The Disconnect-ZabbixServer function sends a logout request to the Zabbix server API and removes the local session information.

maml:alert.maml:para: Author: Trent Willingham Check out my other scripts and projects @ https://github.com/twillin912

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the hosts from a Zabbix server.
The Get-ZabbixHost cmdlet gets the hosts from a Zabbix server.
Without parameters, this cmdlet gets all hosts on the server. You can also specify a particular host by host id, group id, or host name.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies one or more hosts by host id. You can type multiple host ids (separated by commas).
Specifies one or more hosts by host name. You can use wildcard characters.
Specifies one or more hosts by group id. You can type multiple group ids (separated by commas).
Specifies one or more hosts by template id. You can type multiple template ids (separated by commas).
Indicates that only the Identity value it returned. This can be useful when piping the output to another command.
Specifies one or more hosts by host id. You can type multiple host ids (separated by commas).
Specifies one or more hosts by host name. You can use wildcard characters.
Specifies one or more hosts by group id. You can type multiple group ids (separated by commas).
Specifies one or more hosts by template id. You can type multiple template ids (separated by commas).
Indicates that only the Identity value it returned. This can be useful when piping the output to another command.

maml:alert.maml:para: Author: Trent Willingham Check out my other scripts and projects @ https://github.com/twillin912

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get all hosts on the server.
In this example we are searching for any hosts where the 'host' field match the search input.
Retrieve host(s) by Id
Get all hosts the belong to the host group 'MyGroup'
Get all hosts the have the template 'Template01' applied

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the host groups from a Zabbix server.
The Get-ZabbixHostGroup cmdlet gets the host groups from a Zabbix server.
Without parameters, this cmdlet gets all host groups on the server. You can also specify a particular group by group id or group name.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies one or more groups by group id. You can type multiple group ids (separated by commas).
Specifies one or more groups by group name. You can use wildcard characters.
Indicates that only the GroupId value it returned. This can be useful when piping the output to another command.
Specifies one or more groups by group id. You can type multiple group ids (separated by commas).
Specifies one or more groups by group name. You can use wildcard characters.
Indicates that only the GroupId value it returned. This can be useful when piping the output to another command.

maml:alert.maml:para: Author: Trent Willingham Check out my other scripts and projects @ https://github.com/twillin912

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get all host groups on the server.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the items from a Zabbix server.
The Get-ZabbixItem cmdlet gets the items from a Zabbix server.
Without parameters, this cmdlet gets all items on the server. You can also specify a particular item[s] by item id, host id, item name, or item key.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies one or more items by item id. You can type multiple item ids (separated by commas).
Specifies one or more items by host id. You can type multiple host ids (separated by commas).
Specifies one or more items by item name. You can use wildcard characters.
Specifies one or more items by item key. You can use wildcard characters.
Indicates that only the ItemId and ValueType values are returned. This can be useful when piping the output to another command.
Specifies one or more items by item id. You can type multiple item ids (separated by commas).
Specifies one or more items by host id. You can type multiple host ids (separated by commas).
Specifies one or more items by item name. You can use wildcard characters.
Specifies one or more items by item key. You can use wildcard characters.
Indicates that only the ItemId and ValueType values are returned. This can be useful when piping the output to another command.

maml:alert.maml:para: Author: Trent Willingham Check out my other scripts and projects @ https://github.com/twillin912

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get all items on the server.
Get data for items with id 100 or 101
Get item data for all items on the host 'MyServer'
Get item data where the name value matches the input string
Get item data where the key value matches the input string

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the item history from a Zabbix server.
The Get-ZabbixItemHistory cmdlet gets the item history from a Zabbix server.
Without parameters, this cmdlet gets all items on the server. You can also specify a particular item[s] by item id, host id, item name, or item key.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies one or more items by item id. You can type multiple item ids (separated by commas).
{{Fill ValueType Description}}
Indicates the number of values to return for each item. By default only the most recent value is returned.
Specifies one or more items by item id. You can type multiple item ids (separated by commas).
{{Fill ValueType Description}}
Indicates the number of values to return for each item. By default only the most recent value is returned.

maml:alert.maml:para: Author: Trent Willingham Check out my other scripts and projects @ https://github.com/twillin912

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get all items on the server.
Get item data for an item with item id 100
Get item data for all items on the host 'MyServer'
Get item data where the name value matches the input string
Get item data where the key value matches the input string

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the templates from a Zabbix server.
The Get-ZabbixTemplate cmdlet gets the templates from a Zabbix server.
Without parameters, this cmdlet gets all templates on the server. You can also specify a particular template by template id, group id, or template name.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies one or more templates by template id. You can type multiple template ids (separated by commas).
Specifies one or more templates by group id. You can type multiple group ids (separated by commas).
Specifies one or more templates by template name. You can use wildcard characters.
Indicates that only the TemplateId value it returned. This can be useful when piping the output to another command.
Specifies one or more templates by template id. You can type multiple template ids (separated by commas).
Specifies one or more templates by group id. You can type multiple group ids (separated by commas).
Specifies one or more templates by template name. You can use wildcard characters.
Indicates that only the TemplateId value it returned. This can be useful when piping the output to another command.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get all templates on the server.
Get data for templates with id 10000 or 10001
Get template data where the template name matches the input value.
Get template data for all templates in the group 'Group01'

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new host group on the Zabbix server.
The New-ZabbixHostGroup cmdlet creates a new host groups on the Zabbix server.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the groups to create.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the name of the groups to create.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
